page.title: 10CHAPEL WOOD FARM.
page.content: Chapel Wood Farm G.R.453980 stands on the gently sloping hill above Mount Grace Priory.Mr & Mrs Hutchinson run the farm which is owned by their family who have 3 farms in the area.Parts of the farm are over 400 years old.On the farm of 94 acres rye, corn and barley are grown,also hay for silage.Every other year potatoes are grown.There are 100 dairy cows, about 78 of which are milked at any one time,also 8 beef cattle which are fattened for market.They keep 69 sheep 12 sows and 1 boar.Hens and ducks are allowed to roam free_range in the yard.It is a busy life, milking takes place each day at 7.30 am and 5.00pm A boy helps them 3 or 4 days a week and every other weekend a girl takes over the milking.Farm machinery is shared between the 3 farms the family owns.
